com.informatica.mdm.spi.externalcall

Interface CustomLogic


  • public interface CustomLogic
    Encapsulates Custom Logic.

    Possible uses cases:

    • Validate "Person" Business Entity before it is created or updated
    • Enrich "Customer" Business Entity with data from external system when it is created

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      commonj.sdo.DataObject process(commonj.sdo.helper.HelperContext helperContext, commonj.sdo.DataObject inputSdo, Map<String,Object> inParams, Map<String,Object> outParams)
      This method is invoked for one service phase (WriteCO.BeforeValidate, MergeCO.AfterEverything, etc).

    • Method Detail

      • process

        commonj.sdo.DataObject process(commonj.sdo.helper.HelperContext helperContext,
                               commonj.sdo.DataObject inputSdo,
                               Map<String,Object> inParams,
                               Map<String,Object> outParams)
                        throws com.informatica.mdm.spi.cs.StepException
        This method is invoked for one service phase (WriteCO.BeforeValidate, MergeCO.AfterEverything, etc). Use Provisioning UI to get complete list of available phases.
        Parameters:
        helperContext - SDO context. can be used to create new SDO objects
        inputSdo - input SDO, same as used by BES itself. Usually it is an instance of Business Entity Record.
        inParams - map with input parameters. Values can be primitive values or SDO instances
        outParams - entries added to this map will be sent back to BES. It can be used ot override some parameter from inParams map
        Returns:
        If return object is NULL, then Hub continue to use old version of the object, if returned object is not NULL, then it is sent back to Hub/BES and used to continue processing. As an example, external web service can enrich "Customer" Entity Record with new data.
        Throws:
        com.informatica.mdm.spi.cs.StepException - if something goes wrong. It can be unexpected exception or, for example, validation error. See "BESExternalCall" project in resource kit as an example how to create validation error
